item.title: Home
item.description: Welcome to Petri Nets 2022 The 43rd International Conference on Application and Theory of Petri Nets and Concurrency with affiliated workshops, advanced tutorials, and the Petri nets PhD course will take place in Bergen, Norway on 19 June - 24 June, 2022. News For the welcome reception on tuesday (today) it is very important to be on time as the doors to Håkonshallen will be closed at 20.00. The M NORD entrance of the building (the one closer to the tram stop) is locked.

item.title: Accepted Papers
item.description: To be announced

item.title: About
item.description: Established in 2004 by the International Institute for Software Technology of the United Nations University (UNU-IIST, currently known as the United Nations University Institute in Macau), the ICTAC conference series aims at bringing together researchers and practitioners from academia, industry and government to present research and exchange ideas and experience addressing challenges in both theoretical aspects of computing and the exploitation of theory through methods and tools for system development. ICTAC also aims to promote research cooperation between developing and industrial countries.

item.title: RV Lectures @ ICTAC
item.description: RV Lectures @ ICTAC, Nov. 30 / Dec. 1 Supported by the Norwegian Research Council FORSTERK-project COEMS Training Network. Volker Stolz, Jose Ignacio Requeno, Martin Leucker Runtime Verification of Streams with TeSSLa Sandro Stucki, Gerardo Schneider, Cesar Sanchez Gray-box Monitorability of Hyperproperties – the Case of Data Minimization Ezio Bartocci et al. Monitoring Cyber-Physical Systems Dejan Ničković Runtime verification for rigorous engineering of cyber-physical systems Giles Reger Monitoring with Data Practicalities Venue: Online (Zoom) Time: tbd.

item.title: About Bergen
item.description: The city of Bergen Bergen is a world heritage city and the gateway to the Fjords of Norway. The city is well-connected to all major European flight hubs. More information on VisitBergen Bergen Weather Heard bad things about Bergen weather? Don’t worry, we’ve ordered reasonable weather! Check the forecast.

item.title: Accommodation
item.description: Bergen is full of centrally located hotels, which are 5-6 tram stops (around 10 mins) away from the conference venue (tram stop: Kronstad). Here we list some hotels in various price ranges in decreasing order.

item.title: ATAED workshop
item.description: Programme - Tuesday, June 21 Room: M004 9:00 – 10:30 Session 1: Welcome and invited talk Sander Leemans, Full Professor RWTH Aachen University. Leveraging frequencies in event data: a pledge for stochastic process mining 10:30 – 11:00 Coffee Break (Room: M130/131) 11:00 – 12:30 Session 2: Stochastics & Statistics Jarne Vandenabeele, Gilles Vermaut, Jari Peeperkorn and Jochen De Weerdt. Enhancing Stochastic Petri Net-based Remaining Time Prediction using k-Nearest Neighbors [PDF] Patrizia Schalk and Lisa Petrak.

item.title: Carl Adam Petri Speaker
item.description: Prof. Paulo Esteves-Verissimo (King Abdullah University of Science and Technology, Saudi Arabia) Assumptions in computer science: mere mathematical hypotheses, or representations of the physical world? [Abstract in PDF] The praxis of algorithm or mechanism design, especially in concurrent or distributed systems, mandates clear statements of the assumptions underlying the design, such as topology, dimension, synchrony, performance, threats, etc. The design — say, of an algorithm whose behaviour is defined by a set of properties (safety, liveness) — is then shown correct by demonstrating it does secure those properties, given the assumptions.

item.title: Conference Venue
item.description:
The conference will take place in the K2 building at Campus Bergen of Western Norway University of Applied Science. You can easily reach the building from either Bergen city centre or Bergen airport by tram (light-rail) The conference venue / Campus is just next to the stop “Kronstad”.
Western Norway University of Applied Sciences Western Norway University of Applied Sciences is one of the largest higher education institution in Norway with approximately 1,800 employees and 16,000 students distributed on five campuses in Førde, Sogndal, Bergen, Stord and Haugesund.

item.title: HEDA workshop
item.description: Programme Monday 20 June 2022 Project meeting (by invitation only) Tuesday 21 June 2022 09:00 - 10:45 Session 1: Opening, Keynote and Short Presentations Keynote: Health Sense Markus Bertl, Gunnar Piho and Peeter Ross. Exploratory Analysis of Health Insurance Billing Data from People with Psychiatric Diseases in Estonia: An Opportunity for Data Science and Artificial Intelligence? Jaroslaw Pasiak, Wojciech Pasiak, Harald Soleim, Remy Andre Monsen, Atle Birger Geitung, Guri-Elise Holgersen and Thomas Fiskeseth Larsen.

item.title: Invited Speaker
item.description: Prof. Volker Diekert (University of Stuttgart, Germany) Petri Nets and Mazurkiewicz Traces Partnership when Honeymoon is Forgotten [Abstract in PDF] History. In the mid 1970-ties it became clear that free partially commutative monoids play a central role for the analysis and the understanding of concurrent systems. The foundations were developed in the 1973 JACM-paper by Robert Keller [1]. A few years later, in 1977 Antoni Mazurkiewicz published his seminal Aarhus technical report where he showed that, indeed, partial commutation describes the semantics of one-safe Petri nets perfectly [2].

item.title: Invited Speaker
item.description: Prof. Marieke Huisman (University of Twente, the Netherlands) VerCors and Alpinist: correctness of GPU applications throughout the development cycle GPU programs are widely used in industry. They make use of special hardware, supporting massive parallelism. To avoid the introduction of errors, we can augment GPU programs with (pre- and postcondition-style) annotations to capture functional properties. The VerCors program verifier, a verifier for concurrent software, has been tailored to reason about such GPU programs, and in this talk I will explain how this is done, and discuss various GPU case studies that have been verified with VerCors.

item.description:
Carl Adam Petri Speaker Prof. Paulo Esteves-Verissimo (King Abdullah University of Science and Technology, Saudi Arabia) Assumptions in computer science: mere mathematical hypotheses, or representations of the physical world? (Read more …)

item.title: Main Track
item.description: Schedule for the main conference track The main conference track will take place in Room M003. Wednesday, 22 Jun | Thursday, 23 Jun | Friday, 24 Jun Wednesday 22 June 2022 9:00 – 9:30 Welcome and openning session 9:30 – 10:30 Distinguish Carl Adam Petri Lecture (Chair: Maciej Koutny) Paulo Esteves-Verissimo: Assumptions in computer science: mere mathematical hypotheses, or representations of the physical world? 10:30 – 11:00 Coffee Break (Room: M130/131)

item.title: Model checking contest
item.description: Programme for the model checking contest The model checking contest will take place on Tuesday afternoon 16.00 - 17.30 in room M003. For further information, see https://mcc.lip6.fr/

item.title: Petri Net Course
item.description: Sunday, 19 Jun | Monday, 20 Jun | Tuesday, 21 Jun The Petri Net Course takes place from Sunday 19 to Tuesday 21. This course offers a thorough introduction to Petri Nets in four half-day modules on Sunday and Monday with an option of a tutorial module (tuesday) on applications of Petri Nets and/or new developments presented by experts in the area. Each module of the course can be taken separately.

item.title: PNSE workshop
item.description: Programme Room: M004 9:00 – 10:30 Session 1: Welcome and keynote (H. Rölke) Einar Broch Johnsen (University of Oslo): Digital Twins - An Emerging Paradigm for Model-Centric Engineering 10:30 – 11:00 Coffee Break (Room: M130/131) 11:00 – 12:30 Session 2: Long paper presentations (25+5) Federica Adobbati, Luca Bernardinello, Görkem Kılınç Soylu and Lucia Pomello: Information flow among transitions of bounded free-choice nets Bart-Jan Hilbrands, Debjyoti Bera and Benny Akesson: Partial Specifications of Component-Based Systems using Petri Nets Lukas Voß, Sven Willrodt, Daniel Moldt, and Michael Haustermann: Between Expressiveness and Verifiability: P/T-nets with Synchronous Channels and Modular Structure 12:30 – 14:00 Lunch (Room: M130/131)

item.title: Social Events
item.description: Tuesday | Wednesday | Thursday Tuesday – Welcome reception The welcome reception will be held in Håkonshallen (The King Håkon’s Hall) on Tuesday (21st June) at 20:00, sponsored by the municipality of Bergen. Beverages and finger food will be served. It is important that attendees arrive on time as the doors will be close at 20:00. Wednesday – Conference dinner The conference dinner will take place at Grand Bergen on Wednesday (22nd June) at 20:00.

item.title: Sponsors
item.description: Sponsored by

item.title: Travel Information
item.description: Public transportation The tram (Bybanen) runs from the airport (Bergen Lufthavn Flesland) to the city centre (Byparken) at there is also a stop at the conference venue. For bus tickets and tram tickets, the Skyss App: https://www.skyss.no/en/tickets-and-prices/buying-tickets/skyss-ticket-app/ is recommended. Getting to Bergen Bergen can easily be reached through its international airport, which is also served by low-cost airlines. In addition, Bergen can be reached by train via Oslo. Another alternative is the overnight ferry from Hirtshals/Denmark.

item.title: Tutorials
item.description: The FCPP AP framework (Monday, 20 Jun) | Model-based SE for/with PNs (Tue, 21 Jun) Spatio-temporal modelling and simulation with the FCPP Aggregate Programming framework Volker Stolz, Western Norway University of Applied Sciences Ferruccio Damiani, University of Turin Giorgio Audrito, University of Turin Date: Monday, 20 June 2022 Time: 14:00–17:30 Room: M005 As the density of computing devices in human environments continues to increase, the costs and challenges of maintaining distributed systems rise, driving a search for solutions increasing the autonomy of computing systems while reducing their overall complexity.

item.description: Affiliated workshops Monday Petri Nets and Software Engineering (PNSE'22) PNSE Programme 12th edition of the Model Checking Contest (MCC'22) MCC programme Tuesday Algorithms and Theories for the Analysis of Event Data (ATAED'22) Programme International Health Data Workshop (HEDA'22) Programme

item.title: Call for Papers
item.description: Call for Tool Demonstrations (Read more …) Call for Papers - Affiliated Workshops (deadline passed) Petri Nets and Software Engineering (PNSE'22): https://www2.informatik.uni-hamburg.de/TGI/events/pnse/ Algorithms and Theories for the Analysis of Event Data (ATAED'22): https://www.fernuni-hagen.de/ataed/ataed2022/ International Health Data Workshop (HEDA'22): https://cs.ttu.ee/events/heda-2022/ Call for Papers - Main conference (deadline passed) The 43rd International Conference on Application and Theory of Petri Nets and Concurrency will take place in Bergen, Norway on 19 June - 24 June, 2022.

item.title: Call for Tool Demonstrations
item.description: Call Tool Demonstrations - Session of Petri Nets 2022 The Petri Nets conferences are the premier venue for researchers active in the field of analysis, design and specification of concurrent systems. Alongside the main conferences and their call for papers, an informal tool demonstration session is organized. Note that, this is a separate event from the dedicated tool-paper-track of PN 2022. The tool demonstration session is intended for researchers and practitioners, to show their recently developed tools to the other conference attendants.

item.title: Proceedings
item.description: The proceedings of the main conference is published by Springer-Verlag as volume 13288 in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science Series (LNCS). Participants registered for the conference have free online access to the proceedings of the conference. LNCS Proceedings of Petri Nets 2022 The organisers have received 50 physical copies of the proceeedings. As there are more than 50 participants registered for the main conference, we have prioritized to provide authors of papers accepted for the main conference with a physical copy.

item.title: Tool Demonstrations
item.description: Alongside the main conferences there will be a tool exhibition and demonstration from Wednesday until Friday in the same room as the coffee breaks. The tool exhibition will be opened as part of the tools session of the main conference on wednesday afternoon combined with a light serving of finger-food and drinks. The following tools will be part of the tool exhibition ecco I ❤ Petri Nets ePNK Tina GreatSPN Titan IOPT-Tools ecco Franck Pommereau, IBISC, Univ.

item.title: Registration
item.description: Registration form and payment Registration for the conference (including Petri net course, workshops and tutorials) and payment is done via the link below IMPORTANT NOTE Registration may be temporarily closed due to maintenance of the Proviso-system. In that case try again later - or contact the organising chairs. Registration Registration fees (late registration) Deadline for early registration was is June 1. For very late conference registrations participation in the conference dinner cannot be guaranteed.
